alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:09AM EST until February 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Looking Glass River Near Eagle affecting Clinton County. .Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain fell overnight across the area. In addition, much of the snow on the ground has rapidly melted, adding to the amount of water reaching the rivers and streams. Several small and medium-sized rivers have risen out of their banks and are into minor flood levels. For the Looking Glass River...including Eagle...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Looking Glass River Near Eagle. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of homes in Dewitt and along the Looking Glass River between Dewitt and Eagle. River levels flood warming hut, playground, and ball field in Looking Glass Valley Park in Wacousta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Thursday was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.7 feet on 06/23/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued Friday morning.
